intro: Crepis lampsanoides, commonly known as the yellow mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a single head, which is a common feature among members of its family. It is native to Europe and is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. Crepis lampsanoides is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
